Cardiff.

     Question               Answers                          Notes                    Total
1.     a                                    Accept values in the range of 21.2 to
                                            21.6 °C.
                                            Accept two different values for the two
                                            solutions from within range.




                                                                                       1




                21.4 °C ✔
                                                                            –4–                                  N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                     Notes                  Total
1.     b        HCl: 30.4 «°C» ✔                                                                 Accept range 30.2 to 30.6 °C.


                CH3COOH: 29.0 «°C» ✔                                                             Accept range 28.8 to 29.2 °C.            2




1.     c        ALTERNATIVE 1                                                                    Accept values of volume in range 25.5
                «volume CH3COOH » 26.0 «cm3» ✔                                                  to 26.5 cm3.
                                                              3
                                                    50.0 cm
                «[CH3COOH]    0.995 mol dm–3                3
                                                                  » 1.91 «mol dm−3» ✔          Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                    26.0 cm
                                                                                                                                          2
                ALTERNATIVE 2
                «n(NaOH) = 0.995 mol dm–3  0.0500 dm3 =» 0.04975 «mol» ✔
                               0.04975
                «[CH3COOH] =             dm3 =» 1.91 «mol dm–3» ✔
                                0.0260

1.     d    i   «total volume  50.0  26.0 » 76.0 cm3 AND «temperature change 29.0  21.4 » Award [2] for correct final answer.
                7.6 «°C» ✔
                                                                                                                                          2
                «q  0.0760 kg  4.18 kJ kg–1 K–1  7.6 K » 2.4 «kJ» ✔
                                                                           –5–                                   N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                                                  Notes                Total
1.     d    ii   «n(NaOH)  0.995 mol dm-3  0.0500 dm3 » 0.04975 «mol»
                 OR
                 «n(CH3COOH)  1.91 mol dm-3  0.0260 dm3 » 0.04966 «mol» ✔
                                                                                                                                        2

                                2.4 kJ                                                           Award [2] for correct final answer.
                 «  H                  »  48 /  49 «kJ mol–1» ✔                         Negative sign is required for M2.
                              0.04975 mol

1.     e         CH3COOH is weak acid/partially ionised ✔
                                                                                                                                        2
                 energy used to ionize weak acid «before reaction with NaOH can occur» ✔

1.     f    i    «initially steep because» greatest concentration/number of particles at start
                 OR
                 «slope decreases because» concentration/number of particles decreases ✔
                                                                                                                                        2
                 volume produced per unit time depends on frequency of collisions
                 OR
                 rate depends on frequency of collisions ✔

1.     f    ii   mass/amount/concentration of metal carbonate more in X
                 OR                                                                                                                     1
                 concentration/amount of CH3COOH more in X ✔
                                                                           –6–                                       N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                             Answers                                                     Notes                Total
2.     a        «series of» lines                                                                    M1 and/or M2 may be shown on a
                OR                                                                                   diagram.
                                                                                                                                            2
                only certain frequencies/wavelengths ✔
                convergence at high«er» frequency/energy/short«er» wavelength ✔

2.     b        electron transfer/transition between high«er» energy level to low«er» energy level   Accept any of the points shown on a
                OR                                                                                   diagram.
                electron transitions into first energy level causes UV series
                OR                                                                                                                          1
                transition into second energy level causes visible series
                OR
                transition into third energy level causes infrared series ✔

2.     c        24  0.786  25  0.101  26  0.113 ✔                                               Award [2] for correct final answer.
                24.33 ✔                                                                             Award [0] for 24.31 with no working    2
                                                                                                     (data booklet value).

2.     d    i                0.4490 g                                                                Award [3] for correct final answer.
                carbon: «               -1
                                           » 0.01020 «mol» / 0.1225 «g»
                            44.01gmol
                OR
                              0.1840 g  2                                                                                                  3
                hydrogen: «                1
                                                » 0.02042 «mol» / 0.0206 «g» ✔
                              18.02 gmol

                oxygen: «0.1595  (0.1225  0.0206) » 0.0164 «g» / 0.001025 «mol» ✔
                empirical formula: C10H20O ✔                                                         Do not award M3 for a hydrocarbon.

2.     d    ii    «temperature » 423 K                                        Award [1] for correct answer with no
                                                                               working shown.
                  OR
                                                                                                           m
                       mRT                                                     Accept “pV = nRT AND n =        ” for M1.
                  M             ✔                                                                         M
                         pV                                                                                                 2
                                           1   1
                         0.150 g  8.31JK mol  423 K
                  «M                                3
                                                          » 156 «g mol1» ✔
                              100.2kPa  0.0337 dm


2.     d    iii   C10H20O ✔                                                                                                 1

2.     e    i     Cl2: first ✔
                                                                                                                            2
                  NO: second ✔

2.     e    ii    rate  k [NO]2 [Cl2] ✔                                                                                    1

2.     e    iii   180 / 1.80  102 «dm6 mol2 min1» ✔                                                                      1
                                                                     –8–                                        N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                      Answers                                                       Notes                   Total
3.     a        increasing number of protons
                OR
                increasing nuclear charge ✔


                «atomic» radius/size decreases
                OR
                                                                                                                                           2
                same number of shells
                OR
                similar shielding «by inner electrons» ✔
                
                «greater energy needed to overcome increased attraction between nucleus and
                electrons»

3.     b        Any three of:


                Group 1:
                atomic/ionic radius increases ✔
                smaller charge density                                                          Do not accept discussion of attraction
                OR                                                                              between valence electrons and
                                                                                                                                         3 max
                force of attraction between metal ions and delocalised electrons decreases ✔   nucleus for M2.
                                                                                                Accept “weaker metallic bonds” for M2.
                Group 17:
                number of electrons/surface area/molar mass increase ✔
                London/dispersion/van der Waals’/vdw forces increase ✔                          Accept “atomic mass” for “molar
                                                                                                mass”.
                                                               –9–                  N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                         Notes                Total
3.     c         P4O10 (s)  6H2O (l)  4H3PO4 (aq) ✔                Accept “P4O10 (s)  2H2O (l) 
                                                                     4HPO3(aq)” (initial reaction).        1

3.     d    i    «distorted» octahedral ✔                            Accept “square bipyramid”.            1
3.     d    ii   Charge on complex ion: 1 ✔
                 Oxidation state of cobalt: 2 ✔                                                           2

3.     e         Lewis «acid-base reaction» ✔
                 H2O: electron/e– pair donor
                 OR                                                                                        2

                 Co2+: electron/e– pair acceptor ✔

     Question                                     Answers                                          Notes                    Total
4.     a                                                                           Accept any combination of dots,
                                           PF3                      PF5            crosses and lines.
                                                                                   Penalize missing lone pairs once only.
                                                                                   Do not apply ECF for molecular
                  Lewis                                                            geometry.
                  structure
                                                      ✔                            Accept values in the range 95–109
                                                                                   for PF3.                                  6
                                                                               ✔

                  Molecular    trigonal pyramidal ✔       trigonal bipyramidal ✔
                  geometry
                  Bond         ≤109«°» ✔                  90«°» AND 120«°»,
                  angles                                  «180«°» » ✔


4.     b        PF3 polar AND PF5 non-polar ✔                                      Apply ECF from part (a) molecular
                                                                                   geometry.                                 1

4.     c        sp3 ✔                                                                                                        1

     Question                                       Answers                                      Notes                  Total
5.     a        ∆HÖ [–165.2  2(–296.9)  2(–92.3)] – [–454.7  2(–245.7)] ✔   Award [2] for correct final answer.

                «∆HÖ»2.5 «kJ» ✔                                               Award [1] for –2.5 «kJ».
                                                                                Do not accept ECF for M2 if more than    2
                                                                                one error in M1.


5.     b        «∆SÖ [208.5  2(248.1)  2(186.8)] – [166.9  2(278.6)] »
                                                                                                                         1
                «∆SÖ» 354.2 «J K–1 mol–1» ✔

5.     c        «3 moles of» liquid to «4 moles of» gas
                OR
                «large» positive ∆S
                OR                                                                                                       2
                «large» increase in entropy ✔


                T∆S  ∆H «at the reaction temperature» ✔

6.     a    i             [HI]
                                 2

                  Kc                 ✔                                                                                                     1
                         [H2 ][I2 ]

6.     a    ii    45.6 ✔                                                                                                                    1

6.     a    iii   ∆GÖ  «– RT ln K  – (0.00831 kJ K−1 mol−1  761 K  ln 45.6) » – 24.2 «kJ» ✔                                            1

6.     a    iv                                Effect                    Reason                     Award [1 max] if both effects are
                  Increasing the volume, at   none/no effect     AND    same number of «gas»       correct.
                  constant temperature                                  moles/molecules on both    Reason for increasing volume:
                                                                        sides ✔                    Accept “concentration of all reagents
                                                                                                                                            2
                  Increasing the              moves to left      AND    «forward» reaction is      reduced by an equal amount so cancels
                  temperature, at constant                              exothermic ✔               out in Kc expression”.
                  pressure                                                                         Accept “affects both forward and
                                                                                                   backward rates equally.”
                                                                                               – 13 –                   N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                                               Answers                                      Notes                    Total
6.     b    i     HCO3– AND H2O ✔                                                                                                                  1

6.     b    ii    species that has one less proton/H ion «than its conjugate acid»                     Do not accept “differs by one proton/H+
                  OR                                                                                    from conjugate acid”.
                  species that forms its conjugate acid by accepting a proton                                                                      1
                  OR
                  species that is formed when an acid donates a proton ✔
6.     b    iii   oxide ion/O2 ✔                                                                                                                  1

6.     c    i     [H3O]  6.76  10–5 «mol dm-3» ✔                                                     Accept 4.57  10–7.

                                                                                      ✔
                                                      2                                 2
                                             5                                    5
                                 6.76  10                             6.76  10
                  Ka                                          /                                        Award [3] for correct final answer.
                         0.010  6.76  10              5                                                                                       3
                                                                          0.010

                  4.6  10–7 ✔

6.     c    ii        1.00  10
                                  14

                  «               7
                                        » 2.17  10–8
                       4.6  10
                  OR                                                                                                                               1
                                  14
                      1.00  10
                  «               7
                                        » 2.19  10–8 ✔
                      4.57  10
                                                                         – 14 –                        N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                          Notes                 Total
6.     d        insufficient data to make generalization
                OR
                need to consider «much» larger number of acids
                OR
                hypothesis will continue to be tested with new acids to see if it can stand the test
                of time ✔


                «hypothesis is false as» other acids/HCl/HBr/HCN/transition metal ion/BF3 do not                            2 max
                contain oxygen
                OR
                other acids/HCl/HBr/HCN/transition metal ion/BF3 falsify hypothesis ✔


                correct inductive reasoning «based on the limited sample» ✔
                «hypothesis not valid» as it contradicts current/accepted theories/Brønsted-
                Lowry/Lewis theory ✔
                                                                        – 15 –                                       N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                          Notes                Total
7.     a        Ni(s)  I2 (aq)  2I –(aq)  Ni2(aq) ✔                                                                                     1

7.     b        electron movement «in the wire» from Mn(s) to Ni(s) ✔

                EÖ «for reduction» of Ni2 is greater/less negative than EÖ «for reduction» of Mn2
                OR
                                                                                                                                            2
                Ni2 is stronger oxidizing agent than Mn2
                OR
                Mn is stronger reducing agent than Ni ✔

7.     c        «0.54 V  (1.18 V) = »1.72 «V» ✔                                                    Do not accept 1.72 V.                1

7.     d        Mn «(s)» ✔                                                                                                                  1
                                                                      – 16 –               N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                               Notes                 Total
7.     e        Positive electrode (anode):                                    Accept .
                2Cl– (aq)  Cl2 (g)  2e ✔
                Cl– oxidized because higher concentration
                OR
                electrode potential/E depends on concentration
                OR
                electrode potential values «of H2O and Cl» are close ✔


                Negative electrode (cathode):
                2H2O (l)  2e–  H2 (g)  2OH (aq)
                                                                                                                  4
                OR
                2H(aq)  2e–  H2 (g) ✔
                H2O/H reduced because Na is a weaker oxidizing agent
                OR
                Na not reduced to Na in water
                OR
                H easier to reduce than Na
                OR
                H lower in activity series «than Na» ✔
                                                                      – 17 –                                     N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                      Notes                        Total
8.     a    i     oxidation/redox AND acidified «potassium» dichromate(VI)                      Accept “acidified «potassium»
                  OR                                                                            dichromate” OR “«acidified potassium»
                                                                                                permanganate”.
                                                                                                                                                1
                  oxidation/redox AND «acidified potassium» manganate(VII) ✔
                                                                                                Accept name or formula of the
                                                                                                reagent(s).

8.     a    ii    ALTERNATIVE 1 using K2Cr2O7:
                  Compound A: orange to green AND secondary hydroxyl                            Award [1] for “A: orange to green AND
                                                                                                B: no change”.
                  OR
                                                                                                Award [1] for “A: secondary hydroxyl
                  Compound A: orange to green AND hydroxyl oxidized «by chromium(VI) ions» ✔
                                                                                                AND B: tertiary hydroxyl”.

                  Compound B: no change AND tertiary hydroxyl «not oxidized by chromium(VI)
                  ions» ✔
                                                                                                Accept “alcohol” for “hydroxyl”.
                                                                                                                                                2
                  ALTERNATIVE 2 using KMnO4:
                  Compound A: purple to colourless AND secondary hydroxyl
                                                                                                Award [1] for “A: purple to colourless
                  OR                                                                            AND B: no change”
                  Compound A: purple to colourless AND hydroxyl oxidized «by manganese(VII)     Award [1] for “A: secondary hydroxyl
                  ions» ✔                                                                       AND B: tertiary hydroxyl”.
                                                                                                Accept “purple to brown” for A.
                  Compound B: no change AND tertiary hydroxyl «not oxidized by manganese(VII)
                  ions» ✔

8.     a    iii          Compound             Number of signals             Ratio of areas      Accept ratio of areas in any order.
                            A                5✔                        6:1:1:1:1 ✔             Do not apply ECF for ratios.                    4
                            B                4✔                        6:1:1:2 ✔

(Question 8a continued)

      Question                                        Answers                                                    Notes                      Total
 8.     a    iv   A AND it has a chiral centre/asymmetric carbon atom/carbon with 4 different
                                                                                                                                             1
                  substituents ✔
 8.     a    v                                                                                  Accept structures without tapered
                                                                                                bonds.


                                                                                                                                             1



                                                                   ✔
 8.     b         Initiation:
                  Br2          2Br• ✔
                           UV / hv / heat                                                       Reference to UV/hν/heat not required.

                  Propagation:                                                                  Accept representation of radical without
                  Br•  C2H6  C2H5•  HBr ✔                                                    • (eg, Br, C2H5) if consistent throughout
                  C2H5•  Br2  C2H5Br  Br• ✔                                                  mechanism.
                                                                                                Accept further bromination.                  4
                  Termination:
                  Br•  Br•  Br2                                                               Award [3 max] if initiation, propagation
                                                                                                and termination are not stated or are
                  OR
                                                                                                incorrectly labelled for equations.
                  C2H5•  Br•  C2H5Br
                  OR                                                                            Award [3 max] if methane is used
                  C2H5•  C2H5•  C4H10 ✔                                                       instead of ethane, and/or chlorine is
                                                                                                used instead of bromine.

 8.     c         concentrated HNO3 AND concentrated H2SO4 ✔                                    “concentrated” must occur at least once
                                                                                                                                             1
                                                                                                (with either acid).
                                                                      – 19 –                           N17/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                            Notes                    Total
8.     d        HNO3  2H2SO4  H3 O   NO2  2HSO 4– ✔                              Accept: HNO3  H2SO4  NO2
                                                                                       HSO4 H2O
                                                                                       Accept: HNO3  H2SO4  H2NO3 
                                                                                       HSO4.
                                                                                       Accept single arrow instead of
                                                                                       equilibrium sign.                          1

                                                                                       Accept equivalent two step reactions in
                                                                                       which sulfuric acid first behaves as
                                                                                       strong acid and protonates nitric acid,
                                                                                       before behaving as dehydrating agent
                                                                                       removing water from it.

8.     e




                                                                                       Do not accept curly arrow originating
                curly arrow showing Br  leaving ✔                                     from C of C–Br bond.
                representation of tertiary carbocation ✔
                                                                                                                                  4
                curly arrow going from lone pair/negative charge on O in –OH to C+ ✔
                formation of (CH3)3COH AND Br  ✔                                      Do not accept arrow originating on H in
                                                                                       –OH.


                                                                                       Accept Br  anywhere on product side in
                                                                                       the reaction scheme.
                                                                                       Award [2 max] for an SN2 type
                                                                                       mechanism.
